meanings.definition: A person or thing of enormous size, strength, power, or influence.
meanings.sent1: The titan of the forest, a mighty oak tree, stood tall and proud.
meanings.sent2: The ancient titan, a colossal mountain, loomed over the valley.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant thought it was a titan when it carried a large crumb on its back.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the queen bee reigns as a titan among her subjects.
meanings.sent5: The titan of the sea, a blue whale, glided gracefully through the ocean.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is unusually large or powerful for its kind.
meanings.sent1: The little puppy grew into a titan among its littermates.
meanings.sent2: The lion, known as the jungle titan, ruled over its territory with pride.
meanings.sent3: The tiny seedling grew into a titan of a tree, shading the entire garden.
meanings.sent4: The champion wrestler was a titan in the ring, overpowering all opponents.
meanings.sent5: The massive elephant was a titan of strength, able to uproot trees with ease.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is very important or successful.
meanings.sent1: The titan of the business world, the CEO, made strategic decisions for the company.
meanings.sent2: The star athlete was considered a titan in the world of sports.
meanings.sent3: The little bookshop became a titan in the community, attracting readers from afar.
meanings.sent4: The talented musician rose to become a titan in the music industry.
meanings.sent5: The visionary inventor was a titan of innovation, creating groundbreaking technologies.
